title: Moderating effects of gender and family responsibilities on the relations between work-family policies and job performance. (arXiv:2401.13681v1 [econ.GN])
abstract: This study analyzes the impact of work-family policies (WFP) on job performance, and the possible moderating role of gender and family responsibilities. Hypothesis testing was performed using a structural equation model based on a PLS-SEM approach applied to a sample of 1,511 employees of the Spanish banking sector. The results show that neither the existence nor the accessibility of the WFP has a direct, positive impact on performance, unlike what we expected, but both have an indirect effect via the well-being generated by these policies. We also find that neither gender nor family responsibilities have a significant moderating role on these relations, contrary to what we initially expected.

translated_title: 工作家庭政策与工作绩效之间的关系：性别和家庭责任的调节效应
translated_abstract: 本研究分析了工作家庭政策对工作绩效的影响，以及性别和家庭责任可能的调节作用。使用基于PLS-SEM方法的结构方程模型对西班牙银行业的1,511名员工样本进行了假设检验。结果显示，与我们的预期不同，无论是工作家庭政策的存在还是可获得性都没有直接的正面影响，但两者通过这些政策所产生的福祉间接影响了绩效。我们还发现，性别和家庭责任在这些关系上都没有显著的调节作用，与我们最初的预期相反。
tldr: 该研究分析了工作家庭政策对工作绩效的影响，发现工作家庭政策的存在和可获得性没有直接的正面影响，但通过产生的福祉间接影响了绩效。性别和家庭责任在这些关系上没有显著的调节作用。
en_tdlr: This study analyzes the impact of work-family policies on job performance and finds that the existence and accessibility of these policies do not have a direct positive impact. However, they indirectly affect performance through generated well-being. Gender and family responsibilities do not have a significant moderating role in these relations.
